#labels Featured,Phase-Deploy
#describes how to install and configure ruijieclient

*corresponding version：0.1.1*

  * install from source(tar.gz)
{{{
./configure
make
make install
}}}

  * install from complied package(rpm, deb etc..)
    exert your package managing program to install it.

  * instructions about configuring
     * simplify startup procedure (optional)
{{{
sudo chmod 4755 /usr/local/bin/ruijieclient
}}}
Thus, prefix 'sudo' is not necessary to executing ruijieclient next time。
     * generate configuration template (needed the first time you use it)
{{{
sudo ruijieclient -g
}}}
{{{
or directly execute
sudo ruijieclient
}}}
which produces the same result as the former one.
     * edit configuration
{{{
gedit /etc/ruijie.conf
}}}
      * configuration file format specification
{{{
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<ruijie.conf version="0.1.1">
  <!--This is a sample configuration file of RuijieClient, change it appropriately according to your settings.-->
  <account>
    <Name>123012007078</Name>
    <Password>888888</Password>
  </account>
  <settings>
    <!--0: Standard, 1: Private-->
    <AuthenticationMode>1</AuthenticationMode>
    <NIC>eth0</NIC>
    <EchoInterval>4</EchoInterval>
    <!--IntelligentReconnect: 0: Disable IntelligentReconnect, 1: Enable IntelligentReconnect -->
    <IntelligentReconnect>1</IntelligentReconnect> 
    <!--AutoConnect: 0: Disable AutoConnect, 1: Enable AutoConnect (only available in gruijieclient) -->
    <AutoConnect>0</AutoConnect>
    <!--Fake Version for cheating server-->
    <FakeVersion>3.99</FakeVersion>
    <!--Fake IP for cheating server-->
    <FakeAddress></FakeAddress>
    <!--DHCP mode 0: Disable, 1: Enable DHCP before authentication, 2: Enable DHCP after authentication -->
    <DHCPmode>0</DHCPmode>
  </settings>
</ruijie.conf>
}}}

  * run
    * by 'su'
    open terminal, input 'su'
{{{
ruijieclient
}}}
    * by 'sudo' (provided that sudoer has been set correctly. ubuntu has set it by default)
    open terminal, input the following
{{{
sudo ruijieclient
}}}
	* simplified method (with the prerequisite that you have done optional steps mentioned before)
    open terminal, directly run
{{{
ruijieclient
}}}

*corresponding version：0.1*

  * install from source(tar.gz)
     * download and edit configuration
{{{
wget http://ruijieclient.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/src/ruijie.conf
gedit ruijie.conf
}}}
     * copy configuration
     open terminal, input 'su'
{{{
mkdir -p /etc/ruijieclient
cp ruijie.conf /etc/ruijieclient
}}}
     * compile and install
{{{
./configure
make
make install
}}}
  * install from complied package(rpm, deb etc..)
    * edit configuration
{{{
gedit /etc/ruijieclient/ruijie.conf
}}}

  * run
    * by 'su'
    open terminal, input 'su'
{{{
ruijieclient
}}}
    * by 'sudo' (provided that sudoer has been set correctly. ubuntu has set it by default)
    open terminal, input the following
{{{
sudo ruijieclient
}}}
